value: Morning Prayer

Dearly beloved, we have come together in the presence of Almighty God our heavenly Father, to set forth his praise, to hear his holy Word, and to ask, for ourselves and on behalf of others, those things that are necessary for our life and our salvation. And so that we may prepare ourselves in heart and mind to worship him, let us kneel in silence, and with penitent and obedient hearts confess our sins, that we may obtain forgiveness by his infinite goodness and mercy.
value.label: Confession of Sin

value: Let us confess our sins against God and our neighbor.
value.label: Confession of Sin

value: Silence may be kept.
Officiant and People together, all kneeling

Most merciful God,
we confess that we have sinned against you
in thought, word, and deed,
by what we have done,
and by what we have left undone.
We have not loved you with our whole heart;
we have not loved our neighbors as ourselves.
We are truly sorry and we humbly repent.
For the sake of your Son Jesus Christ,
have mercy on us and forgive us;
that we may delight in your will,
and walk in your ways,
to the glory of your Name.

God of all mercy,
we confess that we have sinned against you,
opposing your will in our lives.
We have denied your goodness in each other,
in ourselves, and in the world you have created.
We repent of the evil that enslaves us,
the evil we have done,
and the evil done on our behalf.
Forgive, restore, and strengthen us
through our Savior Jesus Christ,
that we may abide in your love
and serve only your will.
Almighty God have mercy on us, forgive us all our sins through our Lord Jesus Christ, strengthen us in all goodness, and by the power of the Holy Spirit keep us in eternal life.
Almighty God have mercy on you, forgive you all your sins through our Lord Jesus Christ, strengthen you in all goodness, and by the power of the Holy Spirit keep you in eternal life.
Almighty God have mercy on you, forgive you all your sins through the grace of Jesus Christ, strengthen you in all goodness, and by the power of the Holy Spirit keep you in eternal life.
Invitatory and Psalter
All stand

value.label: Officiant
value.text: Lord, open our lips.
And our mouth shall proclaim your praise.
value.label: People

value: Alleluia.

value.halfverse: therefore let us keep the feast,
value.verse:
Alleluia.
Christ our Passover has been sacrificed for us; *

value.halfverse: but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth. Alleluia.
value.verse: Not with the old leaven, the leaven of malice and evil, *

value.halfverse: death no longer has dominion over him.
value.verse: Christ being raised from the dead will never die again; *
The death that he died, he died to sin, once for all; *
value.halfverse: but the life he lives, he lives to God.
and alive to God in Jesus Christ our Lord. Alleluia.
value.verse: So also consider yourselves dead to sin, *

value.halfverse: the first fruits of those who have fallen asleep.
value.verse: Christ has been raised from the dead, *

value.halfverse: by a man has come also the resurrection of the dead.
value.verse: For since by a man came death, *

value.halfverse: so also in Christ shall all be made alive. Alleluia.
value.verse: For as in Adam all die, *
Come, let us sing to the Lord; *
value.halfverse: let us shout for joy to the Rock of our salvation.

value.verse: Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving *
value.halfverse: and raise a loud shout to him with psalms.

value.verse: For the Lord is a great God, *
value.halfverse: and a great King above all gods.
and the heights of the hills are his also.
value.verse: In his hand are the caverns of the earth, *

value.halfverse: and his hands have molded the dry land.
value.verse: The sea is his, for he made it, *

value.halfverse: and kneel before the Lord our Maker.
value.verse: Come, let us bow down, and bend the knee, *

For he is our God,
and we are the people of his pasture and the sheep of his hand. *
value.halfverse: Oh, that today you would hearken to his voice!

value: Glory to the Father, and to the Son, and to the Holy Spirit: *
as it was in the beginning, is now, and will be for ever. Amen.
Glory to the Father, and to the Son, and to the Holy Spirit: *
as it was in the beginning, is now, and will be for ever. Amen.

value.halfverse:
serve the Lord with gladness
and come before his presence with a song.
value.verse: Be joyful in the Lord, all you lands; *

value.halfverse:
he himself has made us, and we are his;
we are his people and the sheep of his pasture.
value.verse: Know this: The Lord himself is God; *

value.halfverse: give thanks to him and call upon his Name.
value.verse:
Enter his gates with thanksgiving;
go into his courts with praise; *

For the Lord is good;
his mercy is everlasting; *
value.halfverse: and his faithfulness endures from age to age.

value: The Lessons
A Reading from ${longName}.
A Reading from ${longName}.
A Reading from ${longName}.
The Sermon

I believe in God, the Father almighty,
	creator of heaven and earth.
I believe in Jesus Christ, his only son, our Lord.
	He was conceived by the power of the Holy Spirit
	and born of the Virgin Mary.
	He suffered under Pontius Pilate,
	was crucified, died, and was buried. 
	He descended to the dead.
	On the third day he rose again.
	He ascended into heaven,
	and is seated at the right hand of the Father.
	He will come again to judge the living and the dead.
I believe in the Holy Spirit,
	the holy catholic Church,
	the communion of saints,
	the forgiveness of sins,
	the resurrection of the body,
	and the life everlasting.
value.label: The Apostles’ Creed

value: The Prayers

value.label: Officiant
value.text: The Lord be with you.
And also with you.
value.label: People

value.text: Let us pray.
value.label: Officiant
The Lord’s Prayer
value:
Our Father, who art in heaven,
	hallowed be thy Name,
	thy kingdom come,
	thy will be done,
	on earth as it is in heaven.
Give us this day our daily bread.
And forgive us our trespasses,
	as we forgive those
	who trespass against us.
And lead us not into temptation,
	but deliver us from evil.
For thine is the kingdom,
	and the power, and the glory,
	for ever and ever.

value.label: The Lord’s Prayer
value:
Our Father in heaven,
	hallowed be your Name,
	your kingdom come,
	your will be done,
	on earth as in heaven.
Give us today our daily bread.
Forgive us our sins,
	as we forgive those
	who sin against us.
Save us from the time of trial,
	and deliver us from evil.
For the kingdom, the power,
	and the glory are yours,
	now and for ever.

value.label: V.
value.text: Show us your mercy, O Lord;
And grant us your salvation.
value.label: R.

value.text: Clothe your ministers with righteousness;
value.label: V.
R.
value.text: Let your people sing with joy.
Give peace, O Lord, in all the world;
value.label: V.
R.
value.text: For only in you can we live in safety.

value.label: V.
value.text: Lord, keep this nation under your care;
And guide us in the way of justice and truth.
value.label: R.
V.
value.text: Let your way be known upon earth;

value.label: R.
value.text: Your saving health among all nations.

value.label: V.
value.text: Let not the needy, O Lord, be forgotten;

value.label: R.
value.text: Nor the hope of the poor be taken away.
Create in us clean hearts, O God;
value.label: V.
R.
value.text: And sustain us with your Holy Spirit.

value.label: V.
value.text: Save your people, Lord, and bless your inheritance;
Govern and uphold them, now and always.
value.label: R.

value.text: Day by day we bless you;
value.label: V.

value.text: We praise your name for ever.
value.label: R.
V.
value.text: Lord, keep us from all sin today;
Have mercy on us, Lord, have mercy.
value.label: R.
V.
value.text: Lord, show us your love and mercy;

value.label: R.
value.text: For we put our trust in you.

value.label: V.
value.text: In you, Lord, is our hope;
And we shall never hope in vain.
value.label: R.

value: Almighty God, whose most dear Son went not up to joy but first he suffered pain, and entered not into glory before he was crucified: Mercifully grant that we, walking in the way of the cross, may find it none other than the way of life and peace; through Jesus Christ our Lord.
value.label: A Collect for Fridays
A Collect for Saturdays
value: Almighty God, who after the creation of the world rested from all your works and sanctified a day of rest for all your creatures: Grant that we, putting away all earthly anxieties, may be duly prepared for the service of your sanctuary, and that our rest here upon earth may be a preparation for the eternal rest promised to your people in heaven; through Jesus Christ our Lord.

O God, you make us glad with the weekly remembrance of the glorious resurrection of your Son our Lord: Give us this day such blessing through our worship of you, that the week to come may be spent in your favor; through Jesus Christ our Lord.
value.label: A Collect for Sundays

value: The Sermon
Here may be sung a hymn or anthem.
Authorized intercessions and thanksgivings may follow.
Before the close of the Office one or both of the following may be used

Almighty God, Father of all mercies,
we your unworthy servants give you humble thanks
for all your goodness and loving-kindness
to us and to all whom you have made.
We bless you for our creation, preservation,
and all the blessings of this life;
but above all for your immeasurable love
in the redemption of the world by our Lord Jesus Christ;
for the means of grace, and for the hope of glory.

And, we pray, give us such an awareness of your mercies,
that with truly thankful hearts we may show forth your praise,
not only with our lips, but in our lives,
by giving up our selves to your service,
and by walking before you
in holiness and righteousness all our days;
through Jesus Christ our Lord,
to whom, with you and the Holy Spirit,
be honor and glory throughout all ages.
value.label: The General Thanksgiving
A Prayer of St. Chrysostom
value: Almighty God, you have given us grace at this time with one accord to make our common supplication to you; and you have promised through your well-beloved Son that when two or three are gathered together in his Name you will be in the midst of them: Fulfill now, O Lord, our desires and petitions as may be best for us; granting us in this world knowledge of your truth, and in the age to come life everlasting.
Then may be said

value.text: Let us bless the Lord.
Let us bless the Lord. Alleluia, alleluia.
value.response: Thanks be to God. Alleluia, alleluia

value: The Officiant may then conclude with one of the following
The Sermon
